result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry Blancovitch Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING November 20, 2015 at 1:30 p.m. in Br. 36.

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharges plus all other costs and surcharges. Civil judgment if not paid.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim unless approved by agent.  Third party contact is allowed for contact with the child/ren.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention program, if needed.
Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Pay supervision fees.
Restitution set at zero.
AODA asessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henry Blancovitch Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Henry Blancovitch in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 1 DAY of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.

Defendant Henry Blancovitch in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was calendared for a jury trial.  Defendant wants to change his plea.
.
Plea hearing continued...
.
As to count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to count 2:
Pursuant to negotiations court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing continued....
.
As to count 1:
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  The victim was present but chose not to make a statement.
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 15 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program, if needed.
- Attend parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.  Third party contact is allowed for contact with the child/ren.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Henry Blancovitch in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed & returned medical documents to defense. Defense motion to amend the no contact order GRANTED. Court amended No Contact Order to allow defendant to be at hospital during surgery of child, and visit at hospital until child is discharged. Defendant is to have MINIMAL contact with the victim during hospital visits, and contact may ONLY occur in a hospital setting. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined. Case remains set for Jury Trial on 8/24/2015 at 8:30 AM.

Defendant Henry Blancovitch in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion for modification of the no contact order heard.  Defendant's child is having surgery in May and defense requests modification of the no contact order to allow defendant to be present at Children's Hopsital.  Defense to provide confirmation of this event on next court date.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial.  Motions to be filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM018926  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-12-15

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with STEPHANIE B.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Henry Blancovitch in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Henry Blancovitch in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
